Agmazar the Star Titan.name: Agmazar the Star Titan
Agmazar the Star Titan.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.

Agyra, the Forever Storm.name: Agyra, the Forever Storm
Agyra, the Forever Storm.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.

Bezravnis, the Inferno Below.name: Bezravnis, the Inferno Below
Bezravnis, the Inferno Below.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.

Deific Herald (Chaotic Evil).name: Deific Herald (Chaotic Evil)
Deific Herald (Chaotic Evil).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Chaotic Good).name: Deific Herald (Chaotic Good)
Deific Herald (Chaotic Good).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Chaotic Neutral).name: Deific Herald (Chaotic Neutral)
Deific Herald (Chaotic Neutral).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Lawful Evil).name: Deific Herald (Lawful Evil)
Deific Herald (Lawful Evil).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Lawful Good).name: Deific Herald (Lawful Good)
Deific Herald (Lawful Good).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

action->Aura of Retribution (Arrive).name: Aura of Retribution (Arrive)
action->Aura of Retribution (Arrive).description: Arrive (enchantment, good, lawful) Aura of Retribution While within 100 feet of the herald, you and your allies gain the champion's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EAP98XaChJEbgKcK]{Retributive Strike} reaction

action->Holy Smite (Depart).name: Holy Smite (Depart)
action->Holy Smite (Depart).description:
Depart Holy Smite The herald casts 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hVU9msO9yGkxKZ3J]{Divine Wrath} (santicified holy) in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100].

You channel the fury of divinity against your foes. You deal @Damage[5d10[holy,spirit]] damage to enemies in the area, depending on their @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Deific Herald Lawful Good Depart|traits:holy,spirit] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; while it's sickened, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Deific Herald (Lawful Neutral).name: Deific Herald (Lawful Neutral)
Deific Herald (Lawful Neutral).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Neutral Evil).name: Deific Herald (Neutral Evil)
Deific Herald (Neutral Evil).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Deific Herald (Neutral Good).name: Deific Herald (Neutral Good)
Deific Herald (Neutral Good).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

action->Aura of Redemption (Arrive).name: Aura of Redemption (Arrive)
action->Aura of Redemption (Arrive).description: Arrive (enchantment, good) Aura of Redemption While within 100 feet of the herald, you and your allies gain the champion's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tuZnRWHixLArvaIf]{Glimpse of Redemption} reaction

action->Merciful Healing (Depart).name: Merciful Healing (Depart)
action->Merciful Healing (Depart).description:
Depart Merciful Healing The herald casts the 3-action version of 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} with a radius of @Template[type:emanation|distance:100]. This spell targets only you and your allies.

You channel vital energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore @Damage[5d8[healing,vitality]] Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Deific Herald Neutrall Good Depart|traits:holy,spirit,vitality,healing].

Deific Herald (Neutral).name: Deific Herald (Neutral)
Deific Herald (Neutral).publicNotes: Your faith is strong enough to briefly summon a direct representative of your deity, such as the deity's herald. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature and has a Speed of 60 feet. The effects of this spell depend on your deity's alignment.

Ebeshra, the Winged Razor.name: Ebeshra, the Winged Razor
Ebeshra, the Winged Razor.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.

Elemental Herald (Air).name: Elemental Herald (Air)
Elemental Herald (Air).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Supercell Front (Arrive).name: Supercell Front (Arrive)
action->Supercell Front (Arrive).description: Arrive(air) Supercell Front The herald of air arrives in the form of a twisting tornado, with high-speed winds slamming into your enemies. Each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:100] takes @Damage[10d8[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Air Arrive|traits:air].

action->Twister Downdraft (Depart).name: Twister Downdraft  (Depart)
action->Twister Downdraft (Depart).description: Depart (air) Twister Downdraft Each enemy in a @Template[line|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Air Depart|traits:air]. A creature that fails is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if it's on the ground or descends 40 feet if it's in the air. A creature that descends takes falling damage if this forced movement brings it to the ground.

Elemental Herald (Earth).name: Elemental Herald (Earth)
Elemental Herald (Earth).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Tectonic Rise (Arrive).name: Tectonic Rise (Arrive)
action->Tectonic Rise (Arrive).description: Arrive(earth) Tectonic Rise The herald of earth erupts from the ground, splitting it open in a @Template[emanation|distance:50]. Each enemy in the emanation takes @Damage[10d6[slashing]] damage from the flying debris with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Earth Arrive|traits:earth]. Enemies who critically fail fall 30 feet into the crevasse, taking falling damage (the sides of the fissure require successful @Check[athletics|dc:15|traits:action:climb] checks to Climb)

action->Plate Crash (Depart).name: Plate Crash (Depart)
action->Plate Crash (Depart).description: Depart (sonic) Plate Crash The herald of earth sinks back into the ground, and the sides of the crevasse slam together with a deafening blow, dealing @Damage[5d10[sonic]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Earth Depart|traits:sonic] to all enemies in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. An enemy that critically fails is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 10 minutes.

Elemental Herald (Fire).name: Elemental Herald (Fire)
Elemental Herald (Fire).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Magma Flow (Arrive).name: Magma Flow (Arrive)
action->Magma Flow (Arrive).description: Arrive(fire) Magma Flow The herald of fire flows into the area as living magma, dealing @Damage[10d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage to all enemies in a @Template[emanation|distance:60] with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Fire Arrive|traits:fire]

action->Flame Vortex (Depart).name: Flame Vortex (Depart)
action->Flame Vortex (Depart).description: Depart(fire) Flame Vortex Each enemy in a 60-foot line takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Fire Depart|traits:fire] as the fire herald whips into a fire pillar before vanishing.

Elemental Herald (Metal).name: Elemental Herald (Metal)
Elemental Herald (Metal).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Shard Cloud (Arrive).name: Shard Cloud (Arrive)
action->Shard Cloud (Arrive).description: Arrive(metal) Shard Cloud The herald of metal arrives as a cloud of metal shards and static electricity, dealing @Damage[4d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[4d12[electricity]] damage to all enemies in a @Template[emanation|distance:50] with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Metal Arrive|traits:metal]

action->Rust Mist (Depart).name: Rust Mist (Depart)
action->Rust Mist (Depart).description: Depart(metal) Rust Mist The shards in the cloud rapidly rust and cling to enemies in the @Template[emanation|distance:50], dealing @Damage[10d6] damage to metal creatures and objects in the area with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Metal Depart|traits:metal], ignoring Hardness. Unattended objects automatically critically fail this save.

Elemental Herald (Water).name: Elemental Herald (Water)
Elemental Herald (Water).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Hurricane Formation (Arrive).name: Hurricane Formation (Arrive)
action->Hurricane Formation (Arrive).description: Arrive (cold, water) Hurricane Formation The herald of water forms as a miniature hurricane. Each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:60] takes @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage from the slamming rains and @Damage[4d10[cold]] damage from the falling hail with a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Water Arrive|traits:cold,water].

action->Cataclysmic Deluge (Depart).name: Cataclysmic Deluge (Depart)
action->Cataclysmic Deluge (Depart).description: Depart (cold, water) Cataclysmic Deluge The hurricane collapses into a rushing flood, dealing @Damage[6d8[bludgeoning]] damage to all enemies in a @Template[cone|distance:120] with a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Water Depart|traits:cold,water]. A creature that fails its save is pushed 20 feet away from the herald (or 40 feet on a critical failure).

Elemental Herald (Wood).name: Elemental Herald (Wood)
Elemental Herald (Wood).publicNotes: Your meditation into the different elemental planes connects you to them deeply, and this connection allows you to summon a herald of an elemental lord. The herald arrives in the form of a natural disaster centralized on your enemies. The herald occupies the space of a Huge creature. When you Cast this Spell, choose one of the elemental heralds below to summon; if you're a divine spellcaster who worships an elemental lord, you must choose the option matching your deity's element. This spell gains the trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood) matching your choice.

action->Advantageous Roots (Arrive).name: Advantageous Roots (Arrive)
action->Advantageous Roots (Arrive).description:
Arrive (plant, wood) Advantageous Roots The herald of wood bursts forth from the ground as a complex root system. Each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:50] takes @Damage[6d10[piercing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Wood Arrive|traits:plant,wood] as the roots skewer its limbs and body. Each enemy that fails its save takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the herald departs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-summons-assistant.pf2e-summons-assistant-items.Item.8Bx6DgJ391LItD98]{Effect: Advantageous Roots}

action->Retreat to Soil (Depart).name: Retreat to Soil (Depart)
action->Retreat to Soil (Depart).description: Depart(plant, wood) Retreat to Soil The roots retreat into the ground, dealing @Damage[6d10[piercing]] damage to each enemy in a @Template[emanation|distance:50] with a @Check[reflex|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Elemental Herald Wood Depart|traits:plant,wood]. Any creature with a penalty to Speeds from its initial save automatically takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage. The ground in the emanation is difficult terrain after the roots retreat.

Healing Servitor.name: Healing Servitor
Healing Servitor.publicNotes: You call forth a servitor forged from raw vitality energy to heal and bolster your allies.

action->Servitor's Protection (Arrive).name: Servitor's Protection (Arrive)
action->Servitor's Protection (Arrive).description:
The servitor appears in a flash of light, moving from ally to ally and granting them a temporary reprieve. All allies within 20 feet of the Servitor gain 20 temporary Hit Points until the servitor departs.

Heightened (+2) The Arrive effect's temporary Hit Points increase by 8, and the Depart effect's healing and damage to undead increase by 1d8.

action->Servitor's Blessing (Depart).name: Servitor's Blessing (Depart)
action->Servitor's Blessing (Depart).description:
The servitor disappears in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] of vitality energy. All willing living creatures within heal @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d8[healing,vitality]] Hit Points. All undead within take that much damage, with a @Check[fortitude|basic:true|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Healing Servitor Depart|traits:healing,vitality] save.

Heightened (+2) The Arrive effect's temporary Hit Points increase by 8, and the Depart effect's healing and damage to undead increase by 1d8.

action->Light.name: Light
action->Light.description:
You create an orb of light that sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) in a color you choose. If you create the light in the same space as a willing creature, you can attach the light to the creature, causing it to float near that creature as it moves. You can Sustain the spell to move the light up to 60 feet; you can attach or detach it from a creature as part of this movement.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you Cast the Spell while you already have four light spells active, you must choose one of the existing spells to end.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.cVVZXNbV0nElVOPZ]{Spell Effect: Light}

Heightened (4th) The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

action->Light.name: Light
action->Light.description:
You create an orb of light that sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) in a color you choose. If you create the light in the same space as a willing creature, you can attach the light to the creature, causing it to float near that creature as it moves. You can Sustain the spell to move the light up to 60 feet; you can attach or detach it from a creature as part of this movement.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you Cast the Spell while you already have four light spells active, you must choose one of the existing spells to end.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.cVVZXNbV0nElVOPZ]{Spell Effect: Light}

Heightened (4th) The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

Heightened (4th) The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

Heightened (4th) The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

action->Detonate Mine.name: Detonate Mine
action->Detonate Mine.description:
Requirements A mine you deployed is within 100 feet. With a moment's thought, you trigger the detonation of a mine you deployed within 100 feet, causing it to explode in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. This mine deals @Damage[(1+ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[fire]] damage, based on the damage type you selected when that mine was deployed. Creatures in the area can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|basic] save against your class DC.

You can Detonate Mine as a reaction, with the following trigger.

Trigger A creature enters or leaves a square within the burst area of a mine you have deployed.

At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by [[/r 1d6]].

Mogaru, the Final King.name: Mogaru, the Final King
Mogaru, the Final King.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.

action->Plant Banner.name: Plant Banner
action->Plant Banner.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.xEeCaJsQeDtRAVk1]{Plant Banner}

You plant your banner to inspire your allies to hold the line. Plant your banner in a corner of your square. Each ally within a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] centered on your banner immediately gains 4 temporary Hit Points, plus an additional 4 temporary Hit Points at 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter. These temporary Hit Points last for 1 round; each time an ally starts their turn within the burst, their temporary Hit Points are renewed for another round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.KsUQjLQO62BY0lk4]{Effect: Plant Banner}

While your banner is planted, you must signal your tactics abilities using only auditory signals. If your banner is attached to a weapon, you cannot wield that weapon while your banner is planted. While your banner is planted, any effects that normally happen in an emanation around your banner instead happen in a burst that is 10 feet larger (so a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] becomes a @Template[type:burst|distance:40]). The weapon or pole your banner is attached to gains an amount of additional Hardness equal to your level + your Intelligence modifier.

You can use this action again while adjacent to your banner to retrieve it. An enemy adjacent to the square you planted your banner in can remove your banner as an Interact action, ending this effect and preventing you and your allies from gaining any of your banner's other benefits until you have successfully retrieved it.

action->Commander's Banner.name: Commander's Banner
action->Commander's Banner.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.8NtRuNYGiU2iTwgL]{Commander's Banner}

As long as your banner is visible and in your possession, it provides an aura that gives you and all allies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] a +1 status bonus to Will saves and DCs against fear effects. You can pause or resume this effect as part of any action you would typically use to stow or retrieve your banner. If your banner is destroyed or stolen, allies currently benefiting from its bonuses become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. This effect has the aura, emotion, mental, and visual traits.

Tempest of Shades.name: Tempest of Shades
Tempest of Shades.publicNotes: You channel the forces of undeath to briefly call forth an amalgam of the vengeful dead slain by your enemies and allies alike. This amalgam manifests as a large tornado of insubstantial, howling faces.

action->Vortex of Death (Arrive).name: Vortex of Death (Arrive)
action->Vortex of Death (Arrive).description:
Arrive (negative) Vortex of Death Each enemy creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Tempest of Shades Arrive|traits:void] with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3}.

action->Howl of Eternity (Depart).name: Howl of Eternity (Depart)
action->Howl of Eternity (Depart).description:
Depart (emotion, fear, mental) Howl of Eternity The vengeful dead lets out an anguished scream. All your enemies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100] must attempt @Check[will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Tempest of Shades Depart|traits:necromancy,emotion,fear,mental] saves with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Critical Failure The creature is frightened 3. It's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round or until it's no longer frightened, whichever comes first.

The Fluxwraith.name: The Fluxwraith
The Fluxwraith.publicNotes: You break a mirror and cast the shards into the air. Between their thousand fractured reflections, the fluxwraith appears—a thing of broken glass, broken time and broken lives.

action->Interrupted Lives (Arrive).name: Interrupted Lives (Arrive)
action->Interrupted Lives (Arrive).description:
Arrive (transmutation) Interrupted Lives

Each enemy within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Fluxwraith Arrive]. If a creature fails its save, it is shunted into the future, vanishing now but automatically reappearing in the same location after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. A creature can attempt an additional Will save at the end of each of its turns to end the duration. If its original space is occupied when it returns, the creature appears in the nearest unoccupied space. Since the creature is shunted forward in time, it doesn't experience any of the intervening time. Likewise, any effects on the creature with a duration don't decrease their duration, resuming when the creature reappears.

action->Dire Foresight (Depart).name: Dire Foresight (Depart)
action->Dire Foresight (Depart).description:
Depart (divination, fear, mental, prediction) Dire Foresight

Each enemy within a @Template[emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.resources.dc.value)|name:Fluxwraith Depart|traits:fear,mental,prediction]. On a failed save, the creature receives a brief vision of a deeply traumatic event in that lurks among the many possibilities of its future. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical failure) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while they are frightened.

Vorgozen, the Shapeless Feeder.name: Vorgozen, the Shapeless Feeder
Vorgozen, the Shapeless Feeder.publicNotes: You briefly conjure a kaiju, a massive, rampaging monster with a unique name and legendary reputation. It rises from its secluded lair to annihilate your foes. The summoned kaiju occupies the space of a Gargantuan creature.
